word:
When I left Australia, I really thought that I might be back in two years. . . . Should the Lord release me from my work in America, I know of no 


                                     -376- 

place where I would rather be than in Cooranbong. . . . I know of no place on earth so dear to me as Avondale, where we fought so many battles and gained so many victories.--Letter 113, 1902, pp. 7, 8, 11. (To G. A Irwin, June 15, 1902.)
